form_title.ms_form_title_llm_v1: Application for Alien Employment Certification, ES-575-A

full_text: this SECURITY PETING (City) that 110 dedure or IN REPLY REFER SECURITY TO U.S. DEPARTMENT OF LABOR Communication BUREAU OF EMPLOYMENT SECURITY 450 Golden Gate Avenue, Room 10210 P. 0. Box 36017 Tel. 556-5624 UNITED STATES EMPLOYMENT SERVICE UNEMPLOYMENT INSURANCE SERVICE San Francisco, California 94102 January 16, 1967 Mrs. Helen Halsey Beverly Hills, California Re: Application for Alien Employment Certification for Wonk Yuk The Department of Labor has made a determination on your offer of employment to the subject alien who has applied for an immigrant visa. xxxxxxxxxx Form ES-575 has been certified and is enclosed with the supporting docu- ments. All enclosures should be submitted to the Immigration & Natural- ization Service District Office either with your petition (Form I-140) or for consideration of alien's application for adjustment of status. 2. Form ES-575 has been certified and has been forwarded to the Consular office at which the alien will file a visa application. 3. Form ES-575-B has been certified and is enclosed. This letter and the certified form should accompany Forms ES-575-A which you may subsequently file with the local office of the State Employment Service for aliens you desire to employ under this certification. 4. Form ES-575-A has been favorably acted upon by the Department of Labor and is enclosed for submission to the Immigration and Naturalization Service or, if not enclosed, has been forwarded to the Consular office for further consideration under a previously certified job offer (Form ES-575-B). 5. Form ES-575-A could not be acted upon favorably by the Department of Labor for the reason indicated on the form or given in the advisory statement attached to the Form, which is enclosed for return to the alien. 6. Form ES-575 has not been certified for the reason indicated. If Form ES-575-A is enclosed, please return it to the alien and inform him of this action. Remarks: Sincerely yours, cc: Hollywood Glenn E. Brockway, Regional Administrator Bureau of Employment Security
